{{NCAATeamFootballSeason |Year=2009 |Team=Ball State Cardinals |Image=Ball state text logo.jpg |Conference=Mid-American Conference |Division=West |ShortConference=MAC |CoachRank= |APRank= |Record=2â10 |ConfRecord=2â6 |HeadCoach=[[Stan Parrish]] |OffCoach=Eddie Faulkner |DefCoach=Doug Graber |OScheme= |DScheme= |StadiumArena=[[Scheumann Stadium]] |Champion= |BowlTourney= |BowlTourneyResult= }} {{2009 Mid-American Conference football standings}} The '''2009 [[Ball State Cardinals]] [[Ball State Cardinals football|football team]]''' represented [[Ball State University]] in the [[2009 NCAA Division I FBS football season|2009 college football season]]. Ball State competed as a member of the [[Mid-American Conference]] (MAC) West Division. The team was coached by [[Stan Parrish]] and played their homes game at [[Scheumann Stadium]]. The finished with a record of 2â10 (2â6 [[Mid-American Conference|MAC]]). ==Before the season== ===Recruiting=== {{College Athlete Recruit Start|40=yes|collapse=yes|year=2009}} {{College Athlete
